page.title: 15Wortley-Maypole Dancing
page.content: Every summer at Wortley School we have Maypole Dancing. It has been a tradition for over 80 years. We use the original maypole and tie 16 red, blue, green and yellow ribbons on it. Sometimes we make paper flowers to decorate the top. We normally start practising in June. It is hard work dancing round the maypole on hot days and on grass but we all enjoy it very much. Everyone in the school takes part - even the boys. The dances for the infants are easy but it is difficult for them to skip in time to the music. The dances for the older children are very complicated. In some dances such as The Basket the ribbons make a closed plait round the pole. In Spider's Web the ribbons weave an open pattern. Our Maypole Day is always a bright and happy occasion.
